name: K2-75
scenarioDescription:
The K2-75 Exoplanetary System

K2-75 is a star with 1.16 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.56 times its radius. It is located 1861.89 light years away from the solar system.

K2-75 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

K2-75 b

K2-75 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 7.81 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-75.

The mass of K2-75 b is 10.14 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-75 b is 2.67 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-75 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

K2-75 c

K2-75 c was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 18.31 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-75.

The mass of K2-75 c is 11.08 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-75 c is 2.77 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-75 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-75, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by K2.
